text: {{Infobox writer | name = Martha Gellhorn | image = Martha Gellhorn (1941).jpg | imagesize = | caption = Gellhorn, 1941 | pseudonym = |birth_name = Martha Ellis Gellhorn | birth_date = | birth_place = St. Louis, Missouri, US | death_date = | death_place = London, England"Martha Ellis Gellhorn", Encyclopædia Britannica, Retrieved 1 November 2019 | occupation = Author, war correspondent | nationality = American | period = 1934–1989 | genre = War, travel | subject = | movement = | signature = | website = |spouse= }} Martha Gellhorn (November 8, 1908 - February 15, 1998) was an American novelist and journalist. She wrote many novels. She also wrote news stories for the Atlantic Monthly. Gellhorn was born in St. Louis, Missouri. She died by suicide with an overdose of drugs.
